data.title: Hideous food
data.text: We're not really picky people, but this was the worst food.  We arrived for Sunday breakfast.  Seated immediately; coffee arrived right away.  Nice waitress; attentive.  But the food, oh my, was so, so bad.  It was like they used really poor quality ingredients, then fried everything in rancid grease.  How can you mess up bacon, eggs, toast and hash browns????  I think the food arrives at the restaurant in a card board box that needs no refrigeration and will last for years.  Anyway, I'm sorry it's such bad food.  We will never return.

data.title: Lackluster Service
data.text: My son and I tried Marlins for Sunday brunch and we're less than thrilled with our service. We arrived early to avoid the majority of the Sunday rush.  When we arrived there were a few people waiting. I went to the reception area and she wouldn't look at us. Finally I asked if we could put our name on the list and she reluctantly said that sure, we could. We put our name in and waited. After seeing numerous parties ahead of us get seated we approached the podium and noticed our name had been crossed off.  We asked why and she stated they started a new list, but we weren't added to that list. The hostess mentioned they would clear off a booth for us. After 15 more minutes of waiting and seeing others seated, we asked again if our name was on the list and she asked us who we were, again!  After explaining she threw her hands in the air and said "fine" and walked us to our booth. Rude, unfriendly service. We did get a chance to talk to Omar, the general manager, who could not have cared less, and didn't even acknowledge their issues. Other patrons were in this same situation and we talked amongst ourselves while we just had to laugh at the complete lack of care. We will never return, and I doubt many of the other customers will either.  Do yourselves a favor and find another restaurant.

data.title: Enjoyable lunch
data.text: Met friend here for lunch.  Went with their lunch buffet that they offer.  Nice selection of food that changes.  Reasonable prices for the lunch buffet.  Attentive staff

data.title: Sunday Lunch :(
data.text: Went today for lunch with my mother from out of town thinking it would be a good choice,The variety of menu items  and value were both pretty good .around 10 bucks a plate. We chose to forgo the breakfast/lunch buffet as that didn't look to appealing at 1 pm. After a long wait for our food( mind you the "church rush" was over )  we got our meals. The chili was the soup of the day and was cold,not even luke warm . Tasted like it came straight out of the can. The mashed potatoes on the 3 meals that came with them we also cold, we asked the serve to warm them up and the manager brought out 2 small bowls of mashed potatoes and gravy which was odd because those potatoes were cold too but the gravy was warm. The tird guest did not get any new potatoes as the figured 2 must have been good enough.  Not once did our server come by to ask how everything was nor to refill our drinks. I sat with an empty glass through most of my meal . Only when she offered to bring the check did she ask about refills .. I understand this is a family owned place but with such poor service and cold food when the dining room was half empty , I couldn't recommend this place to anyone. The only time i even saw a manager was when she brought out the "hot" mashed potatoes. so I could not tell her how my experience was. Hopefully they will step up their gamer or this place will go the way of the others before it at this location.

data.title: Family owned good eats
data.text: Your next door eatery with fantastic breakfasts and HUGE portions!   I've been going to Marlins on Cliff Avenue for years and I've never been disappointed!

data.title: Breakfast nightmare
data.text:
Something weird about this place.  Clean beautiful inside , but Poor service , poor food 
Got our beverages (coffe w/cream) then Ordered buffet Didn't get cream until I was halfway through eating , breakfast buffet, terrible.  Potatoes were like packaged dehydrated potato casserole mix, eggs were that egg beater stuff, bacon was ok, pancakes and French toast was dry and cold  , we reordered off menu,  chicken fried steak.  Came all curled up on the plate with like warm gravy globes in the middle , received no fork and waitress never returned so we could ask for one,  had to ask for coffee refills , toilet kept flushing while I we using it.   (3x).   
All in all bad experience  ,   Would never step foot in this location.  Other locations are good svc and food

data.title: Great buffet
data.text: Loved all the food in the buffet. Glad we got the buffet bc it seemed that those who ordered off the menu were waiting a long time for their food. This was Friday at Noon hour.

data.title: Better than I expected!
data.text: This is a new location to Sioux Falls, we have eaten at two other locations in the area--this location on Minnesota Ave--way out does the others--super affordable, plenty to eat on the buffet, all four of us eating enjoyed the variety and the flavor and we have 2 picky kids!  Only downfall, service was slower than would have liked--however, our server was swamped, while other folks helped and checked other servers tables around us(even management appearing never stopped by us)...only our server helped us and asked us how we were.  But overall, food was great, affordable, nice and clean atmosphere.

data.title: Multiple visits
data.text:
We have eaten here 5 times in the last 2 weeks. The food is excellent!  It is the perfect comfort food and our new go to. They can be a little slow on service and had to adjust the air temp. It was freezing in there the 1st week. 
Their buffet is amazing and they have one person that all she does is take care of the buffet. She is constantly cleaning, refilling and testing the temperature of the food items.

data.title: Poor
data.text: Not as good as the other marlins. First time there order the hot turkey sandwich and it was cold . Gave them the second chance order the Hot roast beef and it was cold! So if I order a cold sand which would it be hot ? Well not waste my time with this place . Have ate the other ones and there food was great . Maybe they need to retain there employes ? Or is this place going to be like every other that has been there and close down!!!!

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Couldn't wait to try it out.  We eat out all over town.  Ordered the beef chimichanga and it was terrible. Was small and no different than a store bought microwavable there is no way that was made to order.  The cheese sauce was worse than canned nacho sauce. Almost 10 dollars and no kind of side at all. Not sure I an willing to go back. too many other good places in town. Would like to hear other people's opinions on the  Minnesota store.

data.title: Family friendly
data.text: My grandson had an early morning football game on Saturday at the Sanford Sports Complex.   We were both very hungry after the game.  We stopped at Marlin's for brunch.  To our surprise kids were free on Saturday for the buffet.  The food was fresh and there were healthy choices along with more sugary treats.  One could order off the menu as well.  The parking was limited but we got lucky as some customers were just leaving.  Beverages are additional and add up quickly on the bottom line.  Our family has eaten at the Marlin's in Tea.  Always good food and friendly staff.

data.title: Clean environment and good food
data.text: My fiancé and I went here to have breakfast and we really enjoyed it. We loved the mason jar glasses that they used for drinks and our waitress was very friendly. The manager even stopped by to check on us. The only bad thing I can say is that the eggs were a little runny, but I'm not a big egg person so the place still gets 5 stars in my opinion.
